org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram

Interface ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints

  • Enclosing interface:
    ILinkRouteBuilder

    public static interface ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints
    ILinkRouteBuilder at bend points state.

    User may add bend points or fixed bend points using the helper methods.

    Finish and apply the route with apply().

    Since:
    5.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addBendPoint(Point loc)
      Create a new bend point.
      default ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addBendPoints(java.util.Collection<Point> points)
      Add many bend points at once.
      ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addFixedPoint(Point loc)
      Create a new fixed bend point.
      default ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addFixedPoints(java.util.Collection<Point> points)
      Add many fixed bend points at once.
      ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addHorizontalSegment(int nextBendPointX, boolean fixed)
      Add one horizontal segment with y aligned with previous point.
      ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addVerticalSegment(int nextBendPointY, boolean fixed)
      Add one vertical segment with x aligned with previous point.
      void apply()
      Build the route and apply it to the connection it was created from.
      ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints finishHorizontalThenVertical(boolean fixed)
      Add 2 segment : one horizontal with y aligned with previous point, one vertical with x aligned with target anchor.
      ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints finishVerticalThenHorizontal(boolean fixed)
      Add 2 segment : one vertical with x aligned with previous point, one horizontal with y aligned with target anchor.
      java.util.List<ILinkPoint> getAllPoints()
      Get a direct access to all points of the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllPoints

        java.util.List<ILinkPoint> getAllPoints()
        Get a direct access to all points of the connection.

        The returned list is a direct reference, modifying it modifies the ILinkRoute. It does not modify the connection from which this path was built. The path must be applied to the IDiagramLink.setRoute(ILinkRoute).

        Returns:
        the points in coordinates relative to the diagram.

      • addBendPoint

        ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addBendPoint(Point loc)
        Create a new bend point.
        Parameters:
        loc - the point location
        Returns:
        the route builder to use for next steps.

      • addHorizontalSegment

        ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addHorizontalSegment(int nextBendPointX,
                                                  boolean fixed)
        Add one horizontal segment with y aligned with previous point.
        Parameters:
        nextBendPointX - the bend point X position.
        fixed - true to make the bend point is fixed.
        Returns:
        this route instance

      • addVerticalSegment

        ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints addVerticalSegment(int nextBendPointY,

      • finishHorizontalThenVertical

        ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints finishHorizontalThenVertical(boolean fixed)
        Add 2 segment : one horizontal with y aligned with previous point, one vertical with x aligned with target anchor.

        You should call apply() after this method.

        Parameters:
        fixed - true to make the bend point is fixed.
        Returns:
        this route instance

      • finishVerticalThenHorizontal

        ILinkRouteBuilder.BendPoints finishVerticalThenHorizontal(boolean fixed)
        Add 2 segment : one vertical with x aligned with previous point, one horizontal with y aligned with target anchor.

        You should call apply() after this method.

        Parameters:
        fixed - true to make the bend point is fixed.
        Returns:
        this route instance

        Build the route and apply it to the connection it was created from.
